case_title: Ch. Wajid Hussain vs Ch. Maqsood Ahmed

appellant.name: Ch. Wajid Hussain
appellant.address: Khanpur, P.O. Khanbi, Tehsil Sara-e-Almgir, District Gujrat

complaint_summary: The appellant challenged the cancellation of Mutation No. 6095, dated 30.11.2000, which was based on a gift to Mr. Zahir Khan. The appellant argued that the rights of the parties had been settled and could not be reviewed by the appellate authority.
investigation_summary: The court examined the orders of the learned Additional Commissioner (Revenue), Rawalpindi, and found no evidence of fraud, forgery, or misrepresentation in the proceedings related to Mutation No. 6095. The court also noted that the period of limitation was not adhered to by the District Officer (Revenue), Jhelum.
judgment_summary: The court upheld the order of the learned Additional Commissioner (Revenue), Rawalpindi, restoring Mutation No. 6095, dated 30.11.2000, and subsequent Mutations Nos. 7685 and 7686, dated 18.06.2008. The Tehsildar was directed to update the revenue record accordingly.
legal_arguments: The period of limitation under Section 5 of the Limitation Act, 1908 was not adhered to.
No fraud, forgery, or misrepresentation was reported regarding Mutation No. 6095.
Revenue Courts should refrain from adjudicating complicated factual controversies, which are better resolved by Civil Courts.

assets.details: Gifted land under Mutation No. 6095, dated 30.11.2000.

sections: Section 167 of the Land Revenue Act, 1967
Section 115 of the Civil Procedure Code, 1908
key_issues: Applicability of limitation period under the Limitation Act.
Jurisdiction of Revenue Courts versus Civil Courts.

legal_terms.Mutation: A change or transfer in the ownership of land.

words_and_phrases.Record-of-Rights: Official record documenting ownership and possession of land.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the restoration of Mutation No. 6095, dated 30.11.2000, which was based on a gift. The court upheld the order of the Additional Commissioner (Revenue), Rawalpindi, citing adherence to substantive law and the absence of fraud or misrepresentation. The judgment emphasized the importance of the limitation period and the jurisdictional boundaries between Revenue and Civil Courts.
operative_part: Mutations No. 6095, 7685, and 7686 restored. Tehsildar directed to update revenue records.
